scenes.title: Origins
scenes.narration_text: Yoga is a practice from ancient India. The word comes from 'Yuj', meaning to unite. Sage Patanjali described it as a way to quiet the mind.
scenes.visual_prompt: Ancient India. Sage Patanjali writing the 'Yoga Sutras'. Background of nature and temples.

scenes.title: Physical Benefits
scenes.narration_text: Yoga helps stretch and strengthen muscles. It improves flexibility, balance, and reduces body pain.
scenes.visual_prompt: People doing various Asanas (postures). Stretching, balancing.

scenes.title: Mental Peace
scenes.narration_text: It involves breathing techniques and meditation. This calms the mind, reduces stress, and improves concentration.
scenes.visual_prompt: A person meditating in a calm environment. Breathing deeply (Pranayama).

scenes.title: Health Boost
scenes.narration_text: Yoga boosts the immune system, improves heart health, and helps in weight loss. It promotes overall well-being.
scenes.visual_prompt: Diagram of a human body showing heart, blood circulation, and immune system glowing.

scenes.title: Global Reach
scenes.narration_text: Today, yoga is practiced worldwide. The WHO even launched an app to help people practice it anywhere.
scenes.visual_prompt: People of different nationalities practicing yoga. The WHO mYoga App logo.

scenes.title: The Practice
scenes.narration_text: Remember, yoga is not just exercise. It is the union of body and mind. When practiced with awareness, it becomes a way of life.
scenes.visual_prompt: A diverse group of people practicing yoga together in a park, moving in sync with their breath.
